alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 12:22AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Cabarrus County in Piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 AM EST, The river gauge along the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek showed water levels rising to near 12 feet early this morning in response to the period of heavy rainfall yesterday. No additional rainfall is expected overnight, but runoff from the earlier rainfall will likely push the Rocky River above the action stage of 12 feet for several hours. Minor flooding is thus expected or ongoing in the Rocky River channel and nearby tributaries this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mt Pleasant and Midland. - Flooding is most likely along the immediate Rocky River channel. Flooding from Back Creek may approach Pharr Mill Road due to backwater effects from the elevated Rocky River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
